column1: I’ve been having very painful periods for years and was told it might be endometriosis. I’m looking for a gynaecologist who deals with complex cases.
I’m trying to conceive but haven’t had success after a year. I’d like to speak to a specialist who can review things properly.
I’ve been told I have fibroids and want to understand treatment options, possibly surgery, with someone experienced.
My periods are extremely heavy and unpredictable. I’m looking for a gynaecologist to investigate and manage this.
I have chronic pelvic pain and previous scans haven’t shown much. I need a specialist who takes this seriously.
I’ve had multiple miscarriages and want to see a gynaecologist with experience in recurrent pregnancy loss.
I’m approaching menopause and my symptoms are affecting daily life. I’d like to speak to someone who specialises in menopause care.
I’ve been diagnosed with PCOS and want ongoing management rather than just being told to lose weight.
I’m considering a hysterectomy and want a second opinion from a gynaecologist who regularly performs this surgery.
I’ve been told I might have adenomyosis and would like to see a specialist familiar with diagnosing and treating it.
I’m pregnant but considered high-risk and would like to be under the care of an obstetrician with relevant experience.
I have severe PMS / PMDD symptoms and want to see someone who understands hormonal and mental health overlap.
I’m experiencing bleeding between periods and want a proper assessment by a gynaecologist.
I’ve had previous gynaecological surgery and now have ongoing pain. I’m looking for someone experienced with complex follow-ups.
I’m considering fertility preservation (like egg freezing) and want to speak to a specialist before making decisions.
I have vulval pain and discomfort that hasn’t been explained well so far. I’m looking for a specialist who deals with this area.
I’ve been told I may need laparoscopic surgery and want a gynaecologist who does minimally invasive procedures regularly.
I’m struggling with symptoms after childbirth and want a gynaecologist who focuses on postnatal pelvic health.
I’ve had abnormal smear results and want to be seen by someone experienced in colposcopy and follow-up care.
I don’t have a clear diagnosis but feel something isn’t right hormonally or gynaecologically, and I want a thorough specialist review.
